intro: Terminalia rhopalophora var. analalavensis, commonly known as the Madagascar ebony, is a tropical tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood, which is highly valued for its strength and durability. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth margin. It produces small, pale yellow flowers followed by small, round fruits that contain a single seed. This species is often found in humid lowland forests and is an important component of the local ecosystem.
